variant.question: Regarding the transportation of radioactive goods, attention should be paid to the following:

options.text: Limited exposure to passengers on board if stowed in the cabin.
Transportation by air only allowed in specialized aircraft.
Regulated separation distances from packages of radioactive material to passengers on board.
Transportation is not allowed in passenger aircraft, only in cargo aircraft.

variant.question: A list of dangerous goods, which may not be transported by air, can be found in:

options.text: the shipper\`s declaration for dangerous goods.
the Technical Instructions for the Safe Transport of Dangerous Goods by Air.

variant.question: Which of the following is applicable when considering the loading of radioactive materials?

options.text: Transporting this type of Dangerous Good is limited to cargo aircraft.
These materials should be loaded in a way that limits the exposure of persons to radiation.
These materials may only be carried in aeroplanes and from aerodromes specifically approved for the purpose.
The loading of such Dangerous Goods must be undertaken on specifically approved aprons.
